intro: Ania angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf ania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters wide. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassy or rocky areas. Ania angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
